references.reason: This paper introduces dynamic topic models, a fundamental concept for analyzing time-evolving text data, which is a significant contribution to the field and highly relevant to the current research.

references.paper_title: Negative binomial process count and mixture modeling
references.reason: This paper presents a comprehensive approach to count data modeling using the negative binomial process, which is crucial for effectively handling overdispersion and sparsity often found in real-world count time series data.

This paper introduces Poisson-gamma dynamical systems (PGDS), which serves as the foundation for the current research by providing a robust framework for modeling count time series and capturing latent dependencies.

references.paper_title: Nonparametric bayesian factor analysis for dynamic count matrices
references.reason: This paper offers a nonparametric Bayesian approach to analyzing dynamic count matrices, which is highly relevant to the methodology used in the current study and offers insights into handling high-dimensional data.

This paper extends the previous work on PGDS by incorporating Poisson-randomized gamma processes, offering enhanced flexibility and potentially improved performance in capturing complex count time series dynamics.
